maml:description.maml:para: Installs a published NAV App for a tenant.
Use the Install-NAVApp cmdlet to install an already published NAV App for a tenant.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.
Specifies that the installation must run without loading any NAV App data that was saved from an earlier installation of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.

Specifies the language version of Dynamics NAV app. The value must be a valid culture name for a language in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, such as en-US or da-DK. If the specified language does not exist on the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance, then en-US is used.
Returns a NAV App object for the installed NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to install the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value default if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installed.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file that you want to install for the tenant. The NAV App must have already been published to the server instance before you can install it for the tenant.
Specifies that the installation must run without loading any NAV App data that was saved from an earlier installation of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.

Specifies the language version of Dynamics NAV app. The value must be a valid culture name for a language in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, such as en-US or da-DK. If the specified language does not exist on the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance, then en-US is used.
Returns a NAV App object for the installed NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to install the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value default if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installs.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installed.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to install. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing installed.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to install the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value default if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to install the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value default if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file that you want to install for the tenant. The NAV App must have already been published to the server instance before you can install it for the tenant.

Specifies the language version of Dynamics NAV app. The value must be a valid culture name for a language in Microsoft Dynamics NAV, such as en-US or da-DK. If the specified language does not exist on the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance, then en-US is used.
Returns a NAV App object for the installed NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.
Specifies that the installation must run without loading any NAV App data that was saved from an earlier installation of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: Tenant
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example installs the NAV App with the specified name and version for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App includes a database schema change, the tenant database is automatically synchronized.

This example installs a NAV App that is returned from the Get-NAVAppInfo cmdlet for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a database schema change, the tenant database is automatically synchronized.

This example installs the NAV App at the specified path for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. The NAV App must have already been published to the server instance before you can install it for the tenant. If the NAV App contains a database schema change, the tenant database is automatically synchronized.

This example installs the NAV App with the provided name and version for the tenant with an ID of Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized but since the -DoNotLoadData switch was used any data backed up from a previous uninstall of this NAV App will not be loaded.
This example installs the NAV App with the provided name and version on a single tenant NAV server instance. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.
This example installs the NAV App with the provided name and version to all tenants of the DynamicsNAV NAV server instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Publishes an Extension to the app catalog of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.

Use the Publish-NAVApp cmdlet to publish an Extension from a package file (.navx) to the app catalog of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance. Once published, you can install the Extension for individual tenants.

If you have deployed your NAV database to Azure SQL Database, you will need to create a new database to use as the sandbox for completing the publishing process. Use the SandboxDatabaseName, SandboxDatabaseServer, and SandboxDatabaseCredentials parameters to specify the connection information for the database to use as the sandbox.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without verifying the authenticode signature.
Specifies the Extension Package type that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the path where you want to save the log file for any potential publication errors. If the file exists, any errors are added to the log file.
The name of an existing NAV SQL database that you want to use as the Application for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_App'.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the application database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the application database is installed.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.
Specifies the name of the windows service account used by the server to access the NAV Application Database. Only needed when not supplying an existing sandbox database.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without verifying the authenticode signature.
Specifies the Extension Package type that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the path where you want to save the log file for any potential publication errors. If the file exists, any errors are added to the log file.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the path where you want to save the log file for any potential publication errors. If the file exists, any errors are added to the log file.
Forces the command to run without verifying the authenticode signature.
Specifies the Extension Package type that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
The name of an existing NAV SQL database that you want to use as the Application for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_App'.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the application database is installed.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the application database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the windows service account used by the server to access the NAV Application Database. Only needed when not supplying an existing sandbox database.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By value and by property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example publishes the Extension from the Proseware SmartApp.navx package to the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example publishes the Extension from the Proseware SmartApp.navx package to the DynamicsNAV server instance and then returns an Extension object.

This example will attempt to publish the Extension from the Proseware SmartApp.navx package to the DynamicsNAV server instance. The -LogPath will specify the path to a file where errors will be written. If the file exists then errors will be appended.

This example publishes the Extension from the Proseware SmartApp.navx package to the DynamicsNAV server instance by using the DynamicsNAV_Sandbox database on the NAV_SQLServer in Azure as a sandbox. All data within the DynamicsNAV_Sandbox database will be overwritten.
This example publishes the Symbols package from the Proseware SmartApp.navm package to the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example publishes the Proseware SmartApp.navx package to the DynamicsNAV application located at the specified SQL database.

maml:description.maml:para: Repairs a NAV App by recompiling it against the current base application. Use this cmdlet if the base application has changed since publishing the NAV App. It is recommended that the NAV Server instance is restarted after running the repair.
Use the Repair-NAVApp cmdlet to recompile a NAV App that has been published in the app catalog of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.

If you have deployed your NAV database to Azure SQL Database, you will need to create a new database to use as the sandbox for completing the publishing process. Use the SandboxDatabaseName, SandboxDatabaseServer, and SandboxDatabaseCredentials parameters to specify the connection information for the database to use as the sandbox.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be repaired.
The search must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
The name of an existing NAV SQL database that you want to use as the Application for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_App'.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the application database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the application database is installed.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.
Specifies the name of the windows service account used by the server to access the NAV Application Database. Only needed when not supplying an existing sandbox database.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be repaired.
The search must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be repaired.
The search must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be repaired.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully repair.
Specifies the path to the Dynamics NAV IDE executable (finsql.exe).
The name of an existing NAV SQL database that you want to use as the Application for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_App'.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the application database is installed.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the application database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
Specifies the name of the windows service account used by the server to access the NAV Application Database. Only needed when not supplying an existing sandbox database.

The name of an existing SQL database that you want to use as a sandbox for completing the publishing process, such as 'DynamicsNAV_Sandbox'. A database will automatically be created on the same SQL Server as the NAV application database if not provided. If your NAV application database is deployed as an Azure SQL Database, then you must provide an existing database since the cmdlet isn't able to automatically create a new sandbox database. The current content of the sandbox database will be overwritten.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the sandbox database is installed.

Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the sandbox database in SQL Server. You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database. If the sandbox database is an Azure SQL Database, the user name must follow the pattern <username>@<azureserverid>, e.g. navadmin@z8bdostg9d.
The time (in seconds) to wait before terminating an attempt to execute a command on SQL Server, such as reading content or restoring the database from a .bak file.
Gets or sets a switch indicating wether the user should be promted that all data in the sandbox will be deleted.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example repairs the NAV App with a name of Proseware SmartApp and version of 2.3.4.500.
This example repairs all of the NAV Apps in the DynamicsNAV server instance's app catalog.

maml:description.maml:para: Synchronizes an app to the specified tenant's database.
Use the Sync-NAVApp cmdlet to synchronize the schema changes from an app to a tenant database.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
The sync mode that dictates the behavior of the command.
Possible values: Add, Clean
Returns an Extension object for the synced Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant that you want to act on, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant database that you want to act on, such as Data1.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file that you want to synchronize.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
The sync mode that dictates the behavior of the command.
Possible values: Add, Clean
Returns an Extension object for the synced Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant that you want to act on, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant database that you want to act on, such as Data1.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to synchronize. The results must uniquely identify a single NAV App.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file that you want to synchronize.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant that you want to act on, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the ID of a specific tenant database that you want to act on, such as Data1.
The sync mode that dictates the behavior of the command.
Possible values: Add, Clean
Returns an Extension object for the synced Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: Path
By property name: Tenant
By property name: TenantDatabaseId
By property name: Mode

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example synchronizes the NAV app 'Proseware SmartApp' to a tenant database with the id 'Test_Database'.
This example synchronizes the app at the specified path to the tenant database for the tenant with the ID Tenant1.

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstall a NAV App for a tenant.
Use the Uninstall-NAVApp cmdlet to uninstall a NAV App for one or more tenants.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies that the install should be executed without saving the NAV App data for a future install/upgrade of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns a NAV App object for the uninstalled NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to uninstall the NAV App for, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to uninstall for the tenant. The NAV App must have already been published to the server instance before uninstalling it for the tenant.
Specifies that the install should be executed without saving the NAV App data for a future install/upgrade of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns a NAV App object for the uninstalled NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to uninstall the NAV App for, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be uninstalled.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully uninstall.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to uninstall the NAV App for, such as Tenant1.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to uninstall the NAV App for, such as Tenant1.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to uninstall for the tenant. The NAV App must have already been published to the server instance before uninstalling it for the tenant.
Returns a NAV App object for the uninstalled NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies that the install should be executed without saving the NAV App data for a future install/upgrade of the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: Tenant
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uninstalls the NAV App with the provided name and version for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.
This example uninstalls the NAV App returned from the Get-NAVAppInfo cmdlet for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.
This example uninstalls the NAV App at the provided path for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.
This example uninstalls all of the NAV Apps that have been installed for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.

This example uninstalls the NAV App with the provided name and version for the tenant with the ID Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized but since the DoNotSaveData switch was used any data in the NAV App fields being removed will not be saved.

This example uninstalls the NAV App with the provided name and version for a non-multitenant Dynamics NAV server instance. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized.

maml:description.maml:para: Unpublishes a NAV App from the app catalog of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.

Use the Unpublish-NAVApp cmdlet to remove a NAV App from the app catalog of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance. The NAV App cannot be unpublished if it is currently installed for a tenant of the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to unpublish.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublished.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublish.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublish.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to unpublish.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublished.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublish.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be unpublished.
The results must return only a single NAV App to successfully unpublish.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes the NAV App with the specified name from the DynamicsNAV server instance's app catalog.
This example removes the NAV App returned from the Get-NAVAppInfo cmdlet from the DynamicsNAV server instance's app catalog.
This example removes the NAV App at the provided path from the DynamicsNAV server instance's app catalog.

maml:description.maml:para: Upgrades a NAV App to the a specified tenant.
Use the Start-NAVAppDataUpgrade cmdlet to upgrade the data from a old version of Nav App to a new version of Nav App in the tenant database.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns a NAV App object for the upgraded NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to upgrade the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The version of upgraded NAV App must be greater than current installed/uninstalled NAV App , otherwise nothing upgrades.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns a NAV App object for the upgraded NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to upgrade the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The results must return only one NAV App, otherwise nothing upgrades.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The version of upgraded NAV App must be greater than current installed/uninstalled NAV App , otherwise nothing upgrades.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to upgrade. The version of upgraded NAV App must be greater than current installed/uninstalled NAV App , otherwise nothing upgrades.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to upgrade the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to upgrade the NAV App for, such as Tenant1. You can specify the value 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured for multiple tenants. Alternatively, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Returns a NAV App object for the upgraded NAV App. The NAV App object contains the properties of the NAV App, such as name, publisher, and version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: Tenant
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example upgrades the NAV App with the specified name and version for the tenant with the ID Tenant1.
This example upgrades a NAV App that is returned from the Get-NAVAppInfo cmdlet for the tenant with the ID Tenant1.
This example upgrades the NAV App at the specified path for the tenant with the ID Tenant1.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about an NAV App based on the specified package file or the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.

Use the Get-NAVAppInfo cmdlet to get information about a specific NAV App, or to get a list of NAV Apps that have been deployed. The list of deployed NAV Apps can include all NAV Apps that have been published to a Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance, filtered by NAV App properties, or NAV Apps that are installed for a specific tenant. It can also show which NAV Apps have by synced for a specific tenant and what version of the NAV App was installed when any existing data for the NAV App was created for the specified tenant.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the NAV App is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to get the installed NAV Apps for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
Indicates to include any properties of the NAV Apps that are specific to the provided tenant

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the NAV App is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be returned.
Returns the list of installed extensions published with SymbolsOnly
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the NAV App is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to get the installed NAV Apps for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the NAV App is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to return.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
This is an alias of the Id parameter.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the name of the NAV App to be returned.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App to be returned.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the version of the NAV App to be returned.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the CompatibilityId parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to get the installed NAV Apps for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.

Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to get the installed NAV Apps for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.

Specifies the path to a NAV App Package file that you want to return.

By property name: Id

By property name: Publisher

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns information about all of the NAV Apps published on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns information about the NAV App with the specified name and version on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns information about all of the NAV Apps published on the DynamicsNAV server instance that are published by Proseware, Inc.
This example returns information about all of the NAV Apps installed for the tenant with an ID of Tenant1 on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns information about the NAV App from the package file provided.
This example returns information about all of the NAV Apps installed in a single tenant NAV server instance.

This example returns information about all of the NAV Apps published on the DynamicsNAV server instance with any additional properties specific to the tenant 'default'. Additional properties include the Sync State of the NavApp, whether or not the NavApp is installed, and the version number of the NavApp (if any) for which this tenant has any data stored.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes all NAV Apps from the specified, unmounted tenant. This cmdlet should be run against tenants that are not mounted.

Use the Remove-NAVAppsForTenant cmdlet to remove all NAV Apps from a tenant database that cannot be mounted due to metadata conflicts. This cmdlet should be run against tenants that are not mounted. This may change the database schema so you must specify if you do not want to save data, otherwise if will be saved.
Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV application database in SQL Server.
You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.
The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database.
Specifies the name of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database that contains the application tables in the multitenant deployment.
You must also set the ApplicationDatabaseServer parameter.

Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database that contains the application tables is installed in the multitenant deployment. The default value is "." for the current machine.
Specifies the user name and password for a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the database or tenant database (in a multitenant deployment) in SQL Server.
You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.
The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database.
Specifies the name of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database, such as 'Demo Database NAV', that stores the business data.
In a multitenant deployment, this is the name of the tenant database.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database is installed. The default value is "." for the current machine.

Specifies that you do not want to copy data to an archive table if the removal of a NAV App changes the database schema. if you set this parameter, the data will not be archived and you will not be able to restore it if you need to reinstall the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database is installed. The default value is "." for the current machine.
Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database is installed. The default value is "." for the current machine.
This is an alias of the DatabaseServer parameter.
Specifies the name of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database, such as 'Demo Database NAV', that stores the business data.
In a multitenant deployment, this is the name of the tenant database.
Specifies the name of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database, such as 'Demo Database NAV', that stores the business data.
In a multitenant deployment, this is the name of the tenant database.
This is an alias of the DatabaseName parameter.
Specifies the user name and password for a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the database or tenant database (in a multitenant deployment) in SQL Server.
You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.
The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database.

Specifies the name of the computer on which the SQL Server instance for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database that contains the application tables is installed in the multitenant deployment. The default value is "." for the current machine.
Specifies the name of the Microsoft Dynamics NAV database that contains the application tables in the multitenant deployment.
You must also set the ApplicationDatabaseServer parameter.
Specifies the user name and password of a SQL Server Authentication login account that provides access to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV application database in SQL Server.
You use this parameter to access the database by using SQL Server Authentication. If you want to use Windows Authentication, then you can omit this parameter.
The login account must be a member of the db_owner role on the database.

Specifies that you do not want to copy data to an archive table if the removal of a NAV App changes the database schema. if you set this parameter, the data will not be archived and you will not be able to restore it if you need to reinstall the NAV App.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: ApplicationDatabaseServer
By property name: ApplicationDatabaseName
By property name: ApplicationDatabaseCredentials

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Remove-NAVAppsForTenant -ApplicationDatabaseName 'Demo Database NAV' -ApplicationDatabaseServer NAVSQLServer -DatabaseName Tenant1 -DatabaseServer NAVSQLServer

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uninstalls all of the NAV Apps in the unmounted tenant database with the name of Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized and the data will be saved.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Remove-NAVAppsForTenant -ApplicationDatabaseName 'Demo Database NAV)' -ApplicationDatabaseServer NAVSQLServer -DatabaseName Tenant1 -DatabaseServer NAVSQLServer -DoNotSaveData

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uninstalls all of the NAV Apps in the unmounted tenant database with the name of Tenant1. If the NAV App contains a schema change, the tenant database will be synchronized and the data will not be saved since the -DoNotSaveData parameter switch was provided.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about the tabled added or modified by an Extension based on the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Use the Get-NAVAppTableModifications cmdlet to get information about tables modified or added by one or more Extension that have been deployed.

The list of deployed Extensions can include all Extensions that have been published to a Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance, filtered by Extension properties, or Extensions that are installed for a specific tenant.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the Extension is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the Extension. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the Extension.
Specifies the ID of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the name of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the publisher of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the version of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the Extension is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.

Specifies the ID of the tenant whose installed Extensions you want to get table modifications for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
Specifies the ID of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the ID of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
This is an alias of the Id parameter.
Specifies the name of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the name of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the publisher of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
Specifies the version of the Extension whose table modifications are to be returned.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the Extension. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the Extension.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the Extension. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision such as 1.0.0.0. The value is used to indicate if there are compatibility-related code changes between different versions of the Extension.
This is an alias of the CompatibilityId parameter.

Specifies the ID of the tenant whose installed Extensions you want to get table modifications for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.

Specifies the ID of the tenant whose installed Extensions you want to get table modifications for, such as Tenant1. Provide a value of 'default' if the specified server instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance to which the Extension is deployed, such as DynamicsNAV.
By property name: Id
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: CompatibilityId
By property name: Tenant
By value and by property name: ServerInstance

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns table modifications from all of the Extensions published on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns table modifications from the Extension with the specified name and version on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns table modifications from the Extensions on the DynamicsNAV server instance that are published by Proseware, Inc.
This example returns table modifications from the Extensions installed for Tenant1 on the DynamicsNAV server instance.
This example returns table modifications from the Extensions installed in a single tenant NAV server instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the tenants where the specified NAV App is installed.
Use the Get-NAVAppTenant cmdlet to get the tenants where the specified NAV App is installed. You can specify the NAV App by name, publisher, or version.
You can use the returned list of tenants to apply general changes, such as uninstalling the NAV App for all tenants that currently have it installed.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV server instance that the NAV App is deployed to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
Indicates if failed tenants should be included in the list.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV server instance that the NAV App is deployed to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file for the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Indicates if failed tenants should be included in the list.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV server instance that the NAV App is deployed to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
Specifies the ID of the NAV App to be returned.
This is an alias of the Id parameter.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the name of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Specifies the version of the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.
Specifies the path to a NAV App package file for the NAV App that you want to see a list of tenants where it is installed.
Indicates if failed tenants should be included in the list.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Id
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Version
By property name: Path
By property name: IncludeFailed

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets the tenants on the DynamicsNAV server instance that have the version 2.3.4.500 of the Proseware SmartApp installed.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Get-NavAppTenant -ServerInstance DynamicsNAV -Name 'ProseWare SmartApp' -Version 2.3.4.500 | Uninstall-NAVApp -ServerInstance DynamicsNAV -Name 'Proseware SmartApp' -Version 2.3.4.500

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets the tenants on the DynamicsNAV server instance that have the version 2.3.4.500 of the Proseware SmartApp installed and then uninstalls that NAV App for each of those tenants by passing the tenants to the Uninstall-NAVApp cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks for any errors in the tenant database schema.

You use the Test-NAVTenantDatabaseSchema cmdlet to compare the tables in the tenant database to the expected metadata of the tables known to the server. This will help to proactively identify errors in the schema.
The tenant database must first be synchronized before its schema can be analyzed.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to check schema for, such as Tenant1.
This parameter is required unless the specified service instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.

Specifies the name of a Dynamics NAV Server instance, for example, DynamicsNAV or myinstance. You can specify either the full name of an instance, such as MicrosoftDynamicsNavServer$myinstance or the short name such as myinstance.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to check schema for, such as Tenant1.
This parameter is required unless the specified service instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
Specifies the ID of the tenant that you want to check schema for, such as Tenant1.
This parameter is required unless the specified service instance is not configured to run multiple tenants.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Tenant

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example tests the schema of the database belonging to Tenant1, that is mounted against the specified Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
